[Comment]: Mathews to Ali, no run, full on off stump, defended into the covers

[BallNo]: Slip and a short cover in place
[Comment]: Slip and a short cover in place
Mathews to Ali, no run, driven off the back foot to short cover
Mathews to Ali, no run, pushed across full outside off, left alone
Mathews to Ali, FOUR, he's away, dropped in short by Mathews and Moeen latches on with a front-foot pull which goes in the air over midwicket
Mathews to Ali, no run, back of a length at off stump, punched into the covers
Mathews to Ali, no run, on a good length, nips back off the seam and takes Moeen high on the back leg

[BallNo]: Early signs are that there is very little pace in this pitch. Don: "@Fazzy - hard to tell if you're being sarcastic or not..."
[Comment]: Early signs are that there is very little pace in this pitch. Don: "@Fazzy - hard to tell if you're being sarcastic or not..."

[BallNo]: Change of tactic from Sri Lanka. No early spin. Dhammika Prasad to take the other new ball
[Comment]: Change of tactic from Sri Lanka. No early spin. Dhammika Prasad to take the other new ball
Prasad to Hales, 1 wide, starts very wide, but it swings considerably...Hales tries to reach it but it barely pitches on the cut strip
Prasad to Hales, OUT, big strike! Gets his line straighter, it's full outside off, Hales is tempted into having a drive and a thick outside flies at chest height to Jayawardene at slip

[BallNo]: AD Hales c Jayawardene b Prasad 0 (6m 1b 0x4 0x6) SR: 0.00
[Comment]: AD Hales c Jayawardene b Prasad 0 (6m 1b 0x4 0x6) SR: 0.00

[BallNo]: So Hales can't take his opportunity opening the innings today
[Comment]: So Hales can't take his opportunity opening the innings today

[BallNo]: So, an early call for James Taylor. This is a chance he has desperately wanted. Two slips in place
[Comment]: So, an early call for James Taylor. This is a chance he has desperately wanted. Two slips in place
Prasad to Taylor, no run, full outside off, left alone, carries at ankle height to Sangakkara
Prasad to Taylor, no run, shuffles across the crease and defends a delivery which was outside off into midwicket
Prasad to Taylor, no run, gets right across his stumps again, both feet end up outside off, and he punches into the off side
Prasad to Taylor, no run, beaten! Lovely delivery. More swing for Prasad. Full outside off, draws Taylor forward and feels for it away from his body. The ball didn't carry to Sangakkara
Prasad to Taylor, 1 run, a strangled appeal for lbw, Taylor shuffling around again, but he's got some bat on this and is off the mark with a run towards square leg
Mathews to Taylor, no run, full outside off, gentle pace, defended towards the on side
Mathews to Taylor, no run, really is moving a lot in the crease, gets onto off stump again and defends with an open face to backward point
Mathews to Taylor, 1 run, opens the face again and finds the gap this time down to third man
Mathews to Ali, no run, done for a lack of pace, aiming to take this delivery from outside off into the leg side and gets beaten on the inside edge
Mathews to Ali, 1 run, nice-looking shot, leans into a flowing drive but there is cover out at deep point

[BallNo]: Slip and a wide slip/fine gully in place
[Comment]: Slip and a wide slip/fine gully in place
Mathews to Taylor, 1 run, punched off the back foot between cover and mid-off
Prasad to Taylor, no run, full outside off, he lets it go through
Prasad to Taylor, no run, gets across outside off, comes off a think inside edge into his pads
Prasad to Taylor, no run, probing line just outside off, Taylor solidly blocks into the off side...wonder if the bowler would fancy trying to ping one into leg stump? Taylor often leaves it exposed

Prasad to Taylor, no run, big appeal for lbw! Taylor caught on the crease by a good-length delivery which nipped back and struck him above the knee roll, but height not often an issue when Taylor is on strike. Might have been sliding down leg. Was just clipping
Prasad to Taylor, no run, left alone outside off
Prasad to Taylor, no run, that's a cracker! Back of a length, nips away off the seam and beats the outside edge. Superb over from Prasad.
Mathews to Ali, 1 run, full outside off, he comes forward and drives towards mid-off who is deep enough to allow a comfortable single
Mathews to Taylor, 3 runs, a slightly uppish drive, but played safely enough. He drives a full delivery towards the left of mid-off where Herath goes down in instalments and dives over the ball
Mathews to Ali, 1 run, driven strongly square of the wicket to deep point
Mathews to Taylor, no run, gets across outside off stump and defends a length delivery to the covers
Mathews to Taylor, no run, terrific fielding at backward point by Dilshan, intercepts Taylor's strong square drive which looked to be heading for the boundary
Mathews to Taylor, no run, that's very loose, it almost seemed a late decision to play. Was wide outside off and Taylor just fiddled at it with a cross-batted poke
Prasad to Ali, 2 runs, that's a gorgeous piece of timing as he flicks this off his pads through straight midwicket and deep square has to get his stakes on to cut it off
Prasad to Ali, 1 wide, started outside leg and swung further, ended as a big wide
Prasad to Ali, no run, full on middle, defended with a straight bat

[BallNo]: Surath: "Prasad looks in brilliant touch in the opening overs. But can he keep it going in the death overs? that is where the problem is. We miss SLINGA."
[Comment]: Surath: "Prasad looks in brilliant touch in the opening overs. But can he keep it going in the death overs? that is where the problem is. We miss SLINGA."
Prasad to Ali, no run, full on the stumps, shaping back into the left handed, punched firmly to mid-off
Prasad to Ali, FOUR, frees his arms this time, it was full and wide outside off, driven powerfully wide of the short cover and past mid-off
Prasad to Ali, FOUR, that's superbly classy from Moeen, this time the delivery is slightly short and he drives it on the up off the back foot with a little flick of the wrists
Prasad to Ali, no run, fuller at off stump, defended towards backward point

[BallNo]: Surath: "I still back Kula and Malinga to start bowling in the 2015 World Cup. Hope Prasad can come good too as he is a handy bat low down the order."
[Comment]: Surath: "I still back Kula and Malinga to start bowling in the 2015 World Cup. Hope Prasad can come good too as he is a handy bat low down the order."
Mathews to Taylor, no run, a fullish ball outside off, the batsman moves forward to drive and makes good contact but can't beat short cover

Mathews to Taylor, 1 run, good length angling into the right-hander, Taylor stays in his crease and dabs towards midwicket for a quick single, there's a direct hit at the bowler's end but Taylor is easily safe
Mathews to Ali, 1 run, Moeen reaches for a wide one and drives through cover for one more
Mathews to Taylor, no run, Taylor skips down the track but is met with a short of a length ball that cramps him for room, he ends up playing it towards the bowler

Mathews to Taylor, 1 run, gosh Taylor is quick, he drove a fuller ball firmly towards mid-on and sprinted away for a single, the fielder ran to his left, picked up and hit the stumps direct at the non-striker's end, Taylor was safe again
Mathews to Ali, 1 run, Moeen stays back and drives through cover for a single

[BallNo]: Dilshan to bowl, offbreaks from round the wicket to Moeen.
[Comment]: Dilshan to bowl, offbreaks from round the wicket to Moeen.
Dilshan to Ali, no run, tight line and length, wicket to wicket, Moeen stays in his crease and blocks

Dilshan to Ali, OUT, oh my! Moeen stepped out of his crease and had an almighty heave, he wasn't close to the pitch of the ball and it fell well short of him and spun away to beat the bat, the keeper had loads of time to make the stumping. Hang on, Sangakkara said there was an edge. Either way, that's out.

[BallNo]: MM Ali c †Sangakkara b Dilshan 19 (37m 20b 3x4 0x6) SR: 95.00
[Comment]: MM Ali c †Sangakkara b Dilshan 19 (37m 20b 3x4 0x6) SR: 95.00

[BallNo]: Over the wicket to the right-hander.
[Comment]: Over the wicket to the right-hander.
Dilshan to Root, 1 run, nudged off the pads off the back foot through midwicket for a single
Dilshan to Taylor, no run, Taylor tries to cut off the back foot but is beaten outside off stump
Dilshan to Taylor, no run, worked off the pads through square for a single

Dilshan to Taylor, 1 run, Root stays in his crease and punches towards long on for a single, Dilshan tries to run to his right to stop it but the non striker is in his way, he wouldn't have got to it anyway

[BallNo]: Thisara Perera into the attack
[Comment]: Thisara Perera into the attack
NLTC Perera to Taylor, 2 runs, starts by offering up some width, Taylor square drives into the ground and the ball bounces over backward point
NLTC Perera to Taylor, 1 wide, that's very, very wide outside off
NLTC Perera to Taylor, no run, width, again, but Taylor misses out as he only connects with fresh air while trying to play it square through the off side
NLTC Perera to Taylor, no run, excellent fielding, Thirimanne at short cover, to cut off a drive by Taylor as he goes after a full, wide delivery

NLTC Perera to Taylor, SIX, well, well...that's what we've seen plenty of in domestic cricket. Comes down the pitch, fetches this from outside off and deposits it over deep midwicket with a strong bottom-handed flick
NLTC Perera to Taylor, no run, driven up to mid-off
NLTC Perera to Taylor, FOUR, dispatches this one, too. It's a short ball from Perera which Taylor pounces on with a rasping pull through square leg

[BallNo]: Another change of bowling. Rangana Herath into the attack. The fifth bowler already. Slip and a short midwicket
[Comment]: Another change of bowling. Rangana Herath into the attack. The fifth bowler already. Slip and a short midwicket
Herath to Root, 1 run, slides on with the arm, cut it off the stumps to short third man
Herath to Taylor, no run, uses his feet, then defends with bat and pad together
Herath to Taylor, no run, that had him in trouble! Grips and takes the outside edge as Taylor was squared up
Herath to Taylor, no run, driven back to the bowler
Herath to Taylor, 1 run, angled into leg stump, swept strongly out to deep square
Herath to Root, no run, defended into the off side

[BallNo]: Mathews back after the expensive over from Perera
[Comment]: Mathews back after the expensive over from Perera
Mathews to Taylor, no run, full outside off, defended to the covers
Mathews to Taylor, 1 run, tucked off his pads through midwicket
Mathews to Root, no run, nicely bowled, full outside off, moving away from Root who is drawn into pushing at the delivery and gets beaten
Mathews to Root, no run, driven square to point
Mathews to Root, no run, plays across a straight delivery around off stump and finds midwicket
Mathews to Root, 1 run, opens the face to a full delivery outside off, down to third man
Herath to Root, 1 run, short of a length, driven off the back foot to the cover sweeper
Herath to Taylor, no run, gets well forward and defends to the off side
Herath to Taylor, 1 run, this one slides on, Taylor punches off the back foot to the sweeper
Herath to Root, 1 run, fired in full, driven down to long off
Herath to Taylor, 1 run, confident footwork, takes a couple of strides down the pitch and drives to long off
Herath to Root, 1 run, drifts onto the pads and it's clipped to deep square
Mathews to Root, no run, full outside off, a gentle delivery, left alone
Mathews to Root, no run, tighter to the stumps, driven up to mid-off
Mathews to Root, no run, quite wide outside off, Root tries to flick it to the on side but just gets it back to the bowler
Mathews to Root, 1 run, worked into the leg side
Mathews to Taylor, no run, full outside off, dabbed square of the wicket towards point
Mathews to Taylor, 2 runs, works a full, straight delivery through the leg side and there's a little fumble by Kusal in the deep although Taylor was always making that into a second
Herath to Root, no run, blimey, that's close! Almost caught behind and almost bowled. Root trying to late-cut a delivery that was very tight to off stump
Herath to Root, 1 run, this one is played more securely, cut to deep point
Herath to Taylor, no run, big appeal for lbw, although perhaps more so from Sangakkara, as Taylor is taking on the pad as he sweeps but that's going down the leg side
Herath to Taylor, no run, driven to cover
Herath to Taylor, no run, driven hard into the pitch and back to the bowler
Herath to Taylor, 2 runs, connects with the sweep this time, well placed through square leg which allows him another brace

[BallNo]: Time for another of the spin options as Jeevan Mendis comes on
[Comment]: Time for another of the spin options as Jeevan Mendis comes on
BMAJ Mendis to Root, no run, starts short of a length, punched to midwicket
BMAJ Mendis to Root, 1 run, short outside off, Root drives off the back foot to the cover sweeper
BMAJ Mendis to Taylor, no run, pushed into the off side
BMAJ Mendis to Taylor, 1 run, takes this off the stumps and sends it to deep point
BMAJ Mendis to Root, FOUR, low full toss which he puts away which a bottom-handed whip through midwicket
BMAJ Mendis to Root, 2 runs, now this is short outside off, he goes onto the back foot and places it wide of the sweeper
Herath to Taylor, 1 run, compact footwork as he comes down the pitch then drives to long off
Herath to Root, no run, comes forward and pushes at a full delivery with an open face
Herath to Root, no run, slides into the pads
Herath to Root, 1 run, tight run! Dabbed straight to short third man but Taylor races out of the blocks at the non-striker's end and actually makes it quite comfortably
Herath to Taylor, 1 run, opens the face as he drives to place this wide of cover
Herath to Root, no run, defended a little awkwardly on the back foot, squared up a little by some turn

[BallNo]: And the players take a drink. Good little stand forming between these two
[Comment]: And the players take a drink. Good little stand forming between these two
BMAJ Mendis to Taylor, no run, chopped off the stumps to cover
BMAJ Mendis to Taylor, 1 run, touch quicker, pushed into the on side
BMAJ Mendis to Root, no run, full on middle, defended

[BallNo]: Root has swapped his helmet for a wide-brimmed sunhat
[Comment]: Root has swapped his helmet for a wide-brimmed sunhat
BMAJ Mendis to Root, 1 run, driven down the ground to long on
BMAJ Mendis to Taylor, no run, firmly flicked back to the bowler
BMAJ Mendis to Taylor, no run, comes down the pitch and ends up yorking himself, just bunts the delivery back to Mendis

[BallNo]: Still a slip and short cover in place
[Comment]: Still a slip and short cover in place
Herath to Root, 1 run, loses his shape on the shot as he tries to heave this into the leg side off the toe-end of the bat
Herath to Taylor, 1 run, hit and go...whipped with string wrists straight to midwicket but Taylor is so quick between the wickets
Herath to Root, 1 run, dabbed into the off side
Herath to Taylor, 1 run, slightly shorter, played off the back foot into the off side
Herath to Root, no run, fired in full, dug out back to Herath
Herath to Root, no run, opens the face off the back foot and finds point
BMAJ Mendis to Taylor, no run, goes for the sweep, it's a loopier delivery, gets taken on the pad
BMAJ Mendis to Taylor, no run, played back to the bowler

BMAJ Mendis to Taylor, no run, nearly a mix-up! Taylor was down the pitch, driving firmly to mid-on. Taylor was off straight away but Root had needed to take evasive action at the non-striker's end so couldn't respond as quickly

BMAJ Mendis to Taylor, no run, given! Going for the sweep, and umpire Davis is up quickly. But Taylor signals for a review instantly which suggests he's confident he's hit it. And the reply shows a healthy bottom edge into the pad
BMAJ Mendis to Taylor, no run, driven off the back foot to cover
BMAJ Mendis to Taylor, no run, misses out on a short delivery as he picks out Dilshan in the off side

[BallNo]: A maiden from Mendis
[Comment]: A maiden from Mendis

[BallNo]: And now it's the other Mendis - Ajantha
[Comment]: And now it's the other Mendis - Ajantha
BAW Mendis to Root, 1 run, starts full and it's eased down the ground to long on
BAW Mendis to Taylor, 2 runs, paddle-sweeps this from around off stump over his shoulder and down towards fine leg

[BallNo]: Fifty stand between this pair
[Comment]: Fifty stand between this pair
BAW Mendis to Taylor, 1 run, down the pitch and whips along the ground through midwicket

[BallNo]: DanielAlexander: "Mix-up, dives, appeal, review and after all those drama, no runs scored off that over "
[Comment]: DanielAlexander: "Mix-up, dives, appeal, review and after all those drama, no runs scored off that over "
BAW Mendis to Root, no run, played into the off side
BAW Mendis to Root, 1 run, comes down the track and drives just to the right of mid-off who is inside the circle
BAW Mendis to Taylor, SIX, excellent power and placement, goes over the top as he launches a full delivery over the long-off rope
BMAJ Mendis to Root, SIX, back-to-back sixes, for different batsmen, as Root brings out the slog sweep as he picks the googly from Jeevan and clears wide long on
BMAJ Mendis to Root, 1 run, driven down to long on

BMAJ Mendis to Taylor, FOUR, more aggression from Taylor as he comes down the pitch and lofts it over mid-on who had been brought inside the circle, clears him comfortable and beats long off who was running around
BMAJ Mendis to Taylor, 1 run, full delivery, eased down the ground to long off
BMAJ Mendis to Root, 2 runs, opens the face and finds short third man, they get a bonus run as the bowler misses the throw with both Taylor and Root alert to the situation
BMAJ Mendis to Root, no run, full on leg stump, defended

[BallNo]: Surath: "All the pressure built leading upto Ajanthas over is wasted. No turn, Not pitching it in the right areas, easy picking for the batters! Why is he even in the team? "
[Comment]: Surath: "All the pressure built leading upto Ajanthas over is wasted. No turn, Not pitching it in the right areas, easy picking for the batters! Why is he even in the team? "
BAW Mendis to Taylor, 1 run, outside off, pushed into the off side and that takes him to a maiden ODI fifty
BAW Mendis to Root, no run, angled into the pads, Root misses his flick
BAW Mendis to Root, 1 run, angled to short third man, another single straight to a fielder for this pair
BAW Mendis to Taylor, 1 run, down the pitch, loses his shape a little and ends up heaving it through midwicket
BAW Mendis to Root, 1 run, driven up to mid-off who fumbles but it wouldn't have been able to stop the run

BAW Mendis to Taylor, 1 run, paddles this from outside off behind square on the leg side...Sangakkara saw Taylor shaping for the shot and started to move to his left, but the ball was well wide of him

[BallNo]: Back to some pace with Prasad
[Comment]: Back to some pace with Prasad
Prasad to Taylor, 2 runs, back of a length, pulls it through straight midwicket
Prasad to Taylor, 2 runs, now he uses his feet to the quick, too, and whips it through midwicket although wasn't entirely in control as his bottom hand came off the bat

Prasad to Taylor, no run, jabs down on a full delivery, there's an appeal for caught behind...the umpires come together for a chat, and decide to go upstairs. This is not a player review. Pictures aren't especially clear. The ball goes under the toe-end of Taylor's bat. And it's given not out.
Prasad to Taylor, 1 run, angled into the pads, flicked to deep midwicket
Prasad to Root, no run, another appeal, for lbw this time, as Root falls across his shot but the keeper was heading down the leg side...easily missing the stumps
Prasad to Root, 1 run, that was a tight run! Dabbed square of the wicket and Taylor would have been struggling with a direct hit from backward point
BAW Mendis to Root, 1 run, full on the stumps, worked to deep midwicket
BAW Mendis to Taylor, 1 run, dragged down short, pulled in front of square but straight to the man in the deep
BAW Mendis to Root, 1 run, pushed down the leg side, would have been a wide if Root hadn't caught up with it and flicked to deep backward square
BAW Mendis to Taylor, no run, worked from outside off into the leg side
BAW Mendis to Taylor, 1 run, short and wide outside off, Taylor crashes this through the covers but just a single to the sweeper
BAW Mendis to Root, no run, driven square to point
Prasad to Taylor, no run, good delivery, full and straight, Taylor wanting to use his feet again and digs it out to the leg side...gets a few words from Prasad
Prasad to Taylor, no run, full toss, he can't beat mid-on which will annoy him
Prasad to Taylor, no run, full again, outside off and some late swing into Taylor who jabs it out towards the keeper
Prasad to Taylor, FOUR, moment of fortune for Taylor who was coming down the pitch again gets an inside edge just past leg stump and down to fine leg
Prasad to Taylor, 1 run, full outside off, whipped with bottom hand to mid-on and another sharp single
Prasad to Root, 1 run, nice drive from Root to a full delivery but it's a good piece of fielding at mid-off by the captain

[BallNo]: With England forming a solid base, I'm going to hand over to Alex for the first time today
[Comment]: With England forming a solid base, I'm going to hand over to Alex for the first time today

[BallNo]: Cheers Gnasher, morning sports fans, Rangana Herath into the attack...
[Comment]: Cheers Gnasher, morning sports fans, Rangana Herath into the attack...
Herath to Root, no run, off stump and quite full, pressed towards point
Herath to Root, no run, stays leg side to drive a straighter ball to extra cover

Herath to Root, OUT, stays leg side of this again, goes to drive again and gets bowled! The change works for Sri Lanka, Herath has struck with perhaps a quicker ball that Root has misjudged. He should have been playing much straighter but tried to slash it square and missed, losing his middle and off stumps, partnership broken

[BallNo]: JE Root b Herath 36 (77m 49b 1x4 1x6) SR: 73.46
[Comment]: JE Root b Herath 36 (77m 49b 1x4 1x6) SR: 73.46
Herath to Bopara, no run, floaty full delivery, Bopara forward and pressing into the covers
Herath to Bopara, no run, straighter ball, defended up the wicket
Herath to Bopara, 1 run, opens the face to steer this wide of extra cover, it was in the air for a time
Prasad to Bopara, no run, full length on off stump, Bopara forward playing firmly into the covers
Prasad to Bopara, 1 run, fuller ball, driven to extra cover where there's a misfield and they get a run
Prasad to Taylor, no run, blockhole ball, Taylor gets it off the toe to extra cover
Prasad to Taylor, 1 run, another very full ball, dug out towards mid-on, they take on the fielder and a direct hit would have seen Taylor gone
Prasad to Bopara, 1 run, touch wider line, driven on the bounce to backward point who can't take it cleanly and they get a single
Prasad to Taylor, 1 run, cutter, a touch short, pulled out to deep square, Taylor gets an official warning here for running on the pitch, a few times he's gone up the middle
Herath to Taylor, no run, forward on off stump, playing with the outer half of the bat to cover
Herath to Taylor, 1 run, with the inner half this time, gets a thick-edged single into midwicket
Herath to Bopara, 1 run, fuller length, punched down to long-off
Herath to Taylor, 1 run, touch short, cut out to deep cover
Herath to Bopara, no run, full length rolled back to the bowler
Herath to Bopara, 1 run, down the track and slapped down to long-off

[BallNo]: Thisara Perera now comes on...
[Comment]: Thisara Perera now comes on...
NLTC Perera to Bopara, no run, length ball on the stumps, patted back to the bowler
NLTC Perera to Bopara, no run, down the wicket, the bowler adjusts his length a little and Bopara can only push this to mid-off
NLTC Perera to Bopara, 1 run, similar length, this time Bopara stays in the crease and tucks this down to long leg
NLTC Perera to Taylor, FOUR, touch short and Taylor with very fast hands pulls and gets four through deep square
NLTC Perera to Taylor, 1 run, line a foot outside off this time and Taylor cuts to cover
NLTC Perera to Bopara, no run, fuller length, played forward and nudged to midwicket

[BallNo]: Another change, it's now Jeevan Mendis...
[Comment]: Another change, it's now Jeevan Mendis...
BMAJ Mendis to Taylor, no run, short and Taylor cuts strangely up the wicket without timing so the bowler can field
BMAJ Mendis to Taylor, no run, cut again to a ball not that short and finds cover
BMAJ Mendis to Taylor, no run, back to pull this time finding midwicket now
BMAJ Mendis to Taylor, 1 run, finally finds the gap, nudging this up between mid-off and extra cover for a single

[BallNo]: Seems to have tweaked his wrist Taylor, the gloves are off and he's wringing his hand. Out comes the physio and because of the enforced break they're going to take drinks. Bravo umpires saving us some time...
[Comment]: Seems to have tweaked his wrist Taylor, the gloves are off and he's wringing his hand. Out comes the physio and because of the enforced break they're going to take drinks. Bravo umpires saving us some time...
BMAJ Mendis to Bopara, no run, full length, played back to the bowler
BMAJ Mendis to Bopara, 2 runs, paddle swept off the stumps fine of deep backward square, Bopara runs hard and gets back for two

[BallNo]: Decent platform here for England but they need another partnership now to set up the power players for late in the innings...
[Comment]: Decent platform here for England but they need another partnership now to set up the power players for late in the innings...

[BallNo]: Tillakaratne Dilshan now comes on...
[Comment]: Tillakaratne Dilshan now comes on...
Dilshan to Taylor, 1 run, down the track, meets this on the full from outside off and clips it down to long-on
Dilshan to Bopara, no run, cut hard, comes off a but of a top edge but well short of short third man
Dilshan to Bopara, 1 run, back and clips this through square leg for an easy single
Dilshan to Taylor, 1 run, down the track, taps this up on the leg side, short midwicket can't cut it off
Dilshan to Bopara, 1 run, tad short, Bopara back pressing firmly down to long-on
Dilshan to Taylor, FOUR, down the track, aims off side and gets it away nicely, played a little in-to-out to send it over mid-off, comfy gap back there, one bounce four

[BallNo]: We've seen this so often from Taylor in county cricket, great to see him simply carrying on now for England too...
[Comment]: We've seen this so often from Taylor in county cricket, great to see him simply carrying on now for England too...
BMAJ Mendis to Bopara, no run, full ball pressed to short midwicket
BMAJ Mendis to Bopara, 1 run, touch more off stump line and pressed down to long-on
BMAJ Mendis to Taylor, 1 leg bye, started to advance, the bowler fired it at leg stump, Taylor swept and missed, there was a ricochet into the off side and they scamper a single
BMAJ Mendis to Bopara, 1 run, leg stump line, flicked through square leg, 150 up
BMAJ Mendis to Taylor, no run, right back in the crease, pulled hard but only to short midwicket where the cool cookie Mathews makes the save
BMAJ Mendis to Taylor, no run, goes to sweep and gets struck on the pad, it deflects into the covers
Dilshan to Bopara, no run, back foot and clipped with the spin to square leg
Dilshan to Bopara, 1 run, tucks this in front of square leg this time so they scamper a single
Dilshan to Taylor, FOUR, great shot, took a shimmy down, the bowler dropped his length, Taylor adjusts and gets right down to sweep and nails it in the gap between the two deep fielders
Dilshan to Taylor, 1 run, down again, single whipped out to deep midwicket
Dilshan to Bopara, no run, tries to create some length with a backward step but is hurried into forcing this to midwicket
Dilshan to Bopara, 1 run, quicker ball touched to short long leg

[BallNo]: Couple more before the batting Powerplay which, as ever, will be an important stage in the innings, can England make 300...
[Comment]: Couple more before the batting Powerplay which, as ever, will be an important stage in the innings, can England make 300...

BMAJ Mendis to Bopara, 5 runs, full length ran to mid-on, they take a quick single and then...hoho! The fielder throws it right over the keeper's head and it races away for four overthrows! Deep square charged around trying to save the boundary but to no avail, what an awful throw, think it was Thisara Perera
BMAJ Mendis to Taylor, 1 run, leg stump line and swept out to deep square
BMAJ Mendis to Bopara, 1 run, full length whipped out to long-on, always so calm is Bopara

[BallNo]: A very straight deep extra-cover is back...
[Comment]: A very straight deep extra-cover is back...
BMAJ Mendis to Taylor, 2 runs, but this is leg side runs, two of them wide of long-on, excellent placement and running
BMAJ Mendis to Taylor, no run, cramped a little around middle and leg, forces this to short midwicket
BMAJ Mendis to Taylor, 1 run, back tickling this around the corner, an easy single

[BallNo]: Taylor getting a little more treatment on his wrist as the batting Powerplay is taken. Ajantha Medis to bowl...
[Comment]: Taylor getting a little more treatment on his wrist as the batting Powerplay is taken. Ajantha Medis to bowl...

BAW Mendis to Bopara, no run, back just defending this up the wicket
BAW Mendis to Bopara, 1 run, dropped from the off stump in front of point for a sharp single

BAW Mendis to Taylor, OUT, down the wicket, aiming over the off side, gets it off the toe and squirts it to cover! A shame for Taylor who's missed out on a century on his return to the side but he's played very nicely indeed. Aiming over the off side here, trying to play in-to-out, didn't get it quite right, it looped to where cover was shuffling back and claimed an easy catch

[BallNo]: Morgan England captain today, he's been short of runs for a while now...
[Comment]: Morgan England captain today, he's been short of runs for a while now...
BAW Mendis to Morgan, no run, tapped off the stumps into the leg side, no single available
BAW Mendis to Morgan, no run, back covering up in front of off stump

[BallNo]: Just what England didn't want at the start of the Powerplay...
[Comment]: Just what England didn't want at the start of the Powerplay...

[BallNo]: Dilshan again now...
[Comment]: Dilshan again now...

[Comment]: Can Morgan find a way to rotate the strike as Bopara is managing?
Dilshan to Morgan, 1 run, does so here with a nudge into the leg side, an easy single to get Morgan going

Dilshan to Bopara, OUT, back looking to force down the ground and it's through him! Onto Bopara faster than he was anticipating and he's lost his middle and off stumps. Like Root, a total misjudgment really, he exposed his stumps and the delivery ran on and through his stroke, might have kept a touch low

[BallNo]: RS Bopara b Dilshan 22 (47m 31b 0x4 0x6) SR: 70.96

Dilshan to Buttler, 1 run, back clipped out through the leg side
Dilshan to Morgan, no run, also back forcing this from middle stump to cover
Dilshan to Morgan, no run, gets forward now and defends up the wicket

[BallNo]: A disaster so far this Powerplay for England...
[Comment]: A disaster so far this Powerplay for England...
BAW Mendis to Buttler, no run, full ball outside off, Buttler misjudges the length a little and plays and misses outside off
BAW Mendis to Buttler, no run, goes to cut and just finds cover
BAW Mendis to Buttler, no run, back nudging this up to short midwicket
BAW Mendis to Buttler, 2 runs, fuller ball, driven with snappy wrists wide of deep cover so they can get a second
BAW Mendis to Buttler, 1 run, back and tucked from the off stump to deep cover
BAW Mendis to Morgan, FOUR, leg stump line and swept hard and backward of square, poor line from the bowler
Dilshan to Buttler, 1 run, full length outside off, clipped down to long-on
Dilshan to Morgan, no run, back punching to the bowler
Dilshan to Morgan, no run, down the track but just reaching out to block back to the bowler
Dilshan to Morgan, no run, back now playing up the wicket
Dilshan to Morgan, 1 run, goes to cut this hard and gets a thick underedge that goes past leg stump and inside short long leg for an easy single
Dilshan to Buttler, no run, back pressing this to the bowler

[BallNo]: Thos wickets allowing Sri Lanka to slip through a few cheaper overs here...
[Comment]: Thos wickets allowing Sri Lanka to slip through a few cheaper overs here...
BAW Mendis to Morgan, 1 run, long stride forward, this is pressed wide enough of extra-cover to allow a sharp single
BAW Mendis to Buttler, no run, played from the crease off a straight line to midwicket
BAW Mendis to Buttler, no run, more leg stump line, tickled to short long leg
BAW Mendis to Buttler, SIX, floated up outside off and Buttler has room to swing the arms and swings handsomely way back over long-off, so well timed, didn't seem to hit it that hard
BAW Mendis to Buttler, no run, straighter line and this is blocked up the wicket
BAW Mendis to Buttler, no run, this grips a little and Buttler just defends in front of all three

[BallNo]: England 23 for 2 in the Powerplay, not the best...
[Comment]: England 23 for 2 in the Powerplay, not the best...
Dilshan to Morgan, 1 run, length ball pressed out to deep cover
Dilshan to Buttler, 1 run, nudged off a straight line out to deep square
Dilshan to Morgan, 1 run, forward and pressed steadily down the ground for an easy run
Dilshan to Buttler, 1 run, back and clipped out to deep midwicket
Dilshan to Morgan, no run, forward pressing from off stump to extra-cover
Dilshan to Morgan, 1 run, tossed up a bit more, ran out down to long-off

[BallNo]: 10 to go, looks like England aren't going to get up to 300 yet again. Herath is back...
[Comment]: 10 to go, looks like England aren't going to get up to 300 yet again. Herath is back...
Herath to Morgan, no run, reverse swept very firmly and I think this has cannoned straight off the shins of short long leg, ouchie
Herath to Morgan, no run, forward press back to the bowler
Herath to Morgan, no run, touch fuller, clipped to mid-off this time
Herath to Morgan, 1 run, touch straighter line and worked wide of short long leg for a quick single
Herath to Buttler, no run, solid forward defence
Herath to Buttler, no run, another forward press, into the leg side this time
Dilshan to Morgan, 1 run, more air outside off, pressed firmly out to deep cover
Dilshan to Buttler, no run, flatter ball, tucked firmly into short midwicket going back
Dilshan to Buttler, no run, forward now getting a thick inside edge to square leg
Dilshan to Buttler, 1 run, back foot press out to deep cover and the batsman collide mid-pitch which means any thoughts of a second are forgotten
Dilshan to Morgan, no run, forward pressing down the ground, short extra charges across and slides to save the run
Dilshan to Morgan, 1 run, nudged from the crease through the covers to bring the 200 up

[BallNo]: 64 balls between 100-150 and now 63 balls for the next fifty, no acceleration from England and they overs are slipping away...
[Comment]: 64 balls between 100-150 and now 63 balls for the next fifty, no acceleration from England and they overs are slipping away...
Herath to Morgan, 1 run, down the wicket clipping this out to long-on
Herath to Buttler, 1 run, down the track, meets this on the full and clips out to long-on
Herath to Morgan, 1 run, full length, clipped from off stump to long-on

Herath to Buttler, OUT, down the wicket, goes in the air down the ground and picks out long-on. No where near enough club on that, bit of an inside edge and it was a straightforward chance to Jaywardene running a few yards to his left. A big wicket for Sri Lanka who have kept things very quiet since the batting Powerplay

[Comment]: JC Buttler c Jayawardene b Herath 15 (21m 22b 0x4 1x6) SR: 68.18

[BallNo]: Now Ben Stokes couldn't get it off the square the other night, what can he do here...
[Comment]: Now Ben Stokes couldn't get it off the square the other night, what can he do here...
Herath to Stokes, 1 run, this is off the square though, flicked out through square leg from a full length
Herath to Morgan, 1 run, full length again and flicked down the ground for an easy single

[BallNo]: England now have got a job on to get up to 260-270 which they surely need to be competitive...
[Comment]: England now have got a job on to get up to 260-270 which they surely need to be competitive...
Dilshan to Morgan, 2 runs, swept off the stumps, big top edge and it flies over short long leg running back, it was Herath trying to get there and he was never in the frame to take that
Dilshan to Morgan, 1 run, back and punched down to long-on
Dilshan to Stokes, 1 run, full length, pushed firmly off an inside edge to deep square, they rightly refuse the second

[BallNo]: Ajantha Mendis is back...
[Comment]: Ajantha Mendis is back...
BAW Mendis to Morgan, no run, poor line down leg but Morgan misses out and only mistimes a sweep to short long leg

BAW Mendis to Morgan, no run, leg side line again and this time Morgan misses with a sweep, no wide given not sure why, a little pad perhaps? Sangakkara whips off the bails and they check upstairs but Morgan's back foot never shifted
BAW Mendis to Morgan, FOUR, low full toss slapped down the ground, beats mid-off and a most-welcome boundary for England
BAW Mendis to Morgan, 1 run, down leg side again, Morgan sweeps and gets something on it, it runs very fine and they get a single, another one Morgan has rather missed out on
BAW Mendis to Stokes, FOUR, back to a touch short delivery and pulled very hard wide of deep midwicket

BAW Mendis to Stokes, OUT, swept up into the leg side but gets it too high and not long enough, the catch taken by deep square running to his right. A firm strike off a middle and leg line but the timing not quite there, it was a big top edge really, and another wicket falls

[Comment]: Spot of bother now for England, what a change in these last 10 overs...

Dilshan to Morgan, no run, forward nudging from just outside off to backward point
Dilshan to Morgan, SIX, Morgan not deterred by the wickets going down, slog sweep over midwicket, lovely strike
Dilshan to Morgan, 1 run, Dilshan tosses this up again but Morgan resists and presses down to long-off
Dilshan to Woakes, no run, down the track but only nudging this to short midwicket
Dilshan to Woakes, 1 wide, this drifts down the leg side
Dilshan to Woakes, 1 run, down the track, bit of a thick inside edge down to long-on

Herath to Woakes, OUT, a very slow loopy delivery that Woakes tries to slap into the leg side and he's bowled, missing it by a mile really. Couldn't pick up the pace of the delivery, swung right across it and got cleaned up, Woakes has really struggled with spin this tour

[Comment]: 12 more deliveries, is 270 possible?

[BallNo]: Tea A flourish to finish from Eoin Morgan but England's innings fizzled out badly from the batting Powerplay when they were very well set. There was an excellent partnership between Joe Root and James Taylor - who played a superb knock on his comeback - but then wickets started to tumble and not until that last over did England get any acceleration. Sri Lanka managed to strangle England with spin and did a very good job. It would appear to be a below-par total, we'll find out in the chase which begins at 2.15pm local time. Gnasher back with you shortly...
[Comment]: Tea A flourish to finish from Eoin Morgan but England's innings fizzled out badly from the batting Powerplay when they were very well set. There was an excellent partnership between Joe Root and James Taylor - who played a superb knock on his comeback - but then wickets started to tumble and not until that last over did England get any acceleration. Sri Lanka managed to strangle England with spin and did a very good job. It would appear to be a below-par total, we'll find out in the chase which begins at 2.15pm local time. Gnasher back with you shortly...
